stimulusHtml: A capacitor is isolated from its environment, and within the capacitor there is an electric field of strength E. A dielectric material is then placed inside the capacitor, filling a portion of the space between the plates as shown. Within the dielectric material, an additional electric field is established. How does this new electric field compare to the original field E?
choicesHtml: It is a weaker field pointed in the opposite direction.
It is a weaker field pointed in the same direction.
It is a stronger field pointed in the opposite direction.
It is a stronger field pointed in the same direction.
